nodes.title: Google LLC
nodes.short_description: Developer and controller of Android; defines roadmap, licensing, and ecosystem rules via GMS and Play.

nodes.title: Samsung Electronics
nodes.short_description: Largest Android OEM; hardware choices and scale influence platform requirements and feature priorities.

nodes.title: Qualcomm
nodes.short_description: Major Android SoC supplier; modem and CPU/GPU capabilities drive Android performance, features, and timelines.

nodes.title: Arm
nodes.short_description: Licenses CPU architectures used by Android devices; dictates instruction set, performance, efficiency, and compatibilit…

nodes.title: Huawei
nodes.short_description: Major Android OEM; U.S. sanctions removed GMS access, accelerating forks and alternative ecosystems.

nodes.title: Google Mobile Services (GMS)
nodes.short_description: Proprietary Android services and apps; licensing terms shape OEM compliance and device capabilities.

nodes.title: Android Open Source Project (AOSP)
nodes.short_description: Core Android codebase; foundation for OEM builds and forks like Fire OS and HarmonyOS.

nodes.title: Linux kernel
nodes.short_description: Underlying kernel for Android; upstream development affects device support, security, and performance.

nodes.title: iOS
nodes.short_description: Primary competing mobile OS; rivalry drives Android feature development, privacy, and ecosystem strategies.

nodes.title: Digital Markets Act (EU)
nodes.short_description: EU law constraining gatekeeper behaviors; forces Android changes in defaults, app stores, and interoperability.

nodes.title: European Commission Android antitrust decision (2018)
nodes.short_description: Fined Google; mandated unbundling and choice screens, altering Android licensing and distribution in Europe.

nodes.title: U.S. Huawei Entity List (2019)
nodes.short_description: Export controls restricting Huawei; cut GMS access and reshaped Android’s presence in China.

nodes.title: Sundar Pichai
nodes.short_description: Google CEO overseeing Android strategy, ecosystem policies, and compliance with global regulations.

nodes.title: Margrethe Vestager
nodes.short_description: EU competition chief leading actions that forced Android unbundling and default choice changes.

nodes.title: China
nodes.short_description: Restrictions on Google services foster Android forks, alternative app stores, and OEM customization.
